title: Uint8ClampedArray
markdown:
# Uint8ClampedArray

The **`Uint8ClampedArray`** typed array represents an array of 8-bit unsigned integers clamped to 0-255; if you specified a value that is out of the range of \[0,255\], 0 or 255 will be set instead; if you specify a non-integer, the nearest integer will be set. The contents are initialized to `0`. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).

`Uint8ClampedArray` is a subclass of the hidden [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray) class.

## [Constructor](#constructor)

[Uint8ClampedArray()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint8ClampedArray/Uint8ClampedArray)

Creates a new `Uint8ClampedArray` object.

## [Static properties](#static%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits static properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

[Uint8ClampedArray.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `1` in the case of `Uint8ClampedArray`.

## [Static methods](#static%5Fmethods)

_Inherits static methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Instance properties](#instance%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits instance properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

These properties are defined on `Uint8ClampedArray.prototype` and shared by all `Uint8ClampedArray` instances.

[Uint8ClampedArray.prototype.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `1` in the case of a `Uint8ClampedArray`.

[Uint8ClampedArray.prototype.constructor](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/constructor)

The constructor function that created the instance object. For `Uint8ClampedArray` instances, the initial value is the [Uint8ClampedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint8ClampedArray/Uint8ClampedArray) constructor.

## [Instance methods](#instance%5Fmethods)

_Inherits instance methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Different ways to create a Uint8ClampedArray](#different%5Fways%5Fto%5Fcreate%5Fa%5Fuint8clampedarray)

```
// From a length
const uintc8 = new Uint8ClampedArray(2);
uintc8[0] = 42;
uintc8[1] = 1337;
console.log(uintc8[0]); // 42
console.log(uintc8[1]); // 255 (clamped)
console.log(uintc8.length); // 2
console.log(uintc8.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT); // 1

// From an array
const x = new Uint8ClampedArray([21, 31]);
console.log(x[1]); // 31

// From another TypedArray
const y = new Uint8ClampedArray(x);
console.log(y[0]); // 21

// From an ArrayBuffer
const buffer = new ArrayBuffer(8);
const z = new Uint8ClampedArray(buffer, 1, 4);
console.log(z.byteOffset); // 1

// From an iterable
const iterable = (function* () {
  yield* [1, 2, 3];
})();
const uintc8FromIterable = new Uint8ClampedArray(iterable);
console.log(uintc8FromIterable);
// Uint8ClampedArray [1, 2, 3]

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                         |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# table-49](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/indexed-collections.html#table-49) |

## [Browser compatibility](#browser%5Fcompatibility)

BCD tables only load in the browser
